intro: Crotalaria pseudoflorida, commonly known as the smallflower cowpea, is a herbaceous annual plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its distinctive pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring palmately compound leaves and showy yellow flowers with a distinctive spurred structure. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Its botanical features make it both ecologically significant and sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
